instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.TPS51980: What is TPS51980? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1286 Macbook Pros,  A1297 Macbook Pros,  A1369 Macbook Airs,  A1466 Macbook Airs,  A1370 Macbook Airs,  and A1465 Macbook Airs.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA: What is PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA? PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state that powers the SMC that comes from PP3V3_S5. A blown or corroded L4901 inductor behind it can kepe it from working, inductor number will differ depending on your board. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message: It was water damaged near <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and pin25, sw2, <SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_LL</SIGNAL> is missing, so should i changed <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> or <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
24/25 are the control pins for the gate of high-side MOSFET <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>.
It will never allow current flow if pin 25/<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is not soldered.
Change the chip if its pad is damaged; repair trace if is corroded.
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> if is bad only.
Check for short/low value on L7520/60.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7564</CAPACITOR> are OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message: i changed both <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>. No short on L720/60. R/<CAPACITOR>C7564</CAPACITOR> are ok. Now there is no light and not turn on too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
Trace of pin25/<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> to <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> is OK; resolder all its pins too.
Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.

Also post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message: no more today, see you Monday.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
Trace of pin25/[URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/d1-<CHIP>TPS51980</CHIP>.html"]<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>[/URL] to <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> looks ok.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.2v
3V42. ,<CHIP>U7090</CHIP> p4=3.41v
[URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/d1-<CHIP>TPS51980</CHIP>.html"]<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>[/URL]. basic voltage:p2=0v, p4=0v,p5=0v,p25=0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
"Now there is no light
------------------
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.2v"
SMC is not working now...

Check basic signals and voltages for SMC at page 35, <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> (2 of 2).
Start checking <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.

"basic voltages for <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>"
I talk about pins 23, 13, 22, 29, 12, 21...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
it was missing  <TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR>, i add it and now
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>:
P1=3.41, P3=3.41V,P4=1.7V, P5=3.3V, P6=3.3V, P8=3.2, P7=3.4V

<CHIP>U5000</CHIP>:
<CAPACITOR>C5021</CAPACITOR>,<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>=1.2v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC</SIGNAL>=1.2v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA</SIGNAL>=3.41

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
"<CAPACITOR>C5021</CAPACITOR>,<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>=1.2v"
Are you sure???
Voltage comes from pin 1/<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>...

"Check basic signals and voltages for SMC"
And what about signals?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5021</CAPACITOR>,<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>=3.29V ( you are genious! )
Voltage comes from pin 1/<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>=3.4V
I dont have oscilloscope , i dont know how to check signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Orange light but not turn on
threads.message:
You may need o-scope only for <SIGNAL>SMC_E</SIGNAL>/XTAL and <SIGNAL>SMC_CLK32K</SIGNAL>; the last is not present before <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>.
However, 0.45V DC on it points to oscillation presence; 80% probability...
The 4 <SIGNAL>SMC_TXX</SIGNAL> signals no need o-scope, only DMM; as <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> too.
